tell a joke -> get a joke
three logicians walk into a bar. the bartender asks "do you three want a beer?". the first logician says "I don't know". the second logician says "I don't know". the third logician says yes.
first maths joke that came to mind
i keep thinking Bout the infinite mathematicians walk into a bar
there are like hundred maths jokes and they all are mostly overused
theres also the there are 10 types of people in the world
underused maths joke: whats nine plus ten????
alright this one I only heard once unabsolutely
I discovered it in 6th grade and immediately had an intense argument with my friend about why 1 + 1/2 + 1/4... isn't infinity
my favourite one is about philosopher physicst and mathematician jumping from a plank
You can know math and be dumb too
Razzor join the dark side and study maths in uni
first math joke i thought of when reading that was i eight sum pi
@Vormanax_ i could only think of a french joke when hearing this
absolute wtf is the joke i dont thunk ive heard that one
basically three of them are tasked to jump from a plank on a big height into a pool
philosopher remembers the classics, kant and the like, jumps and misses
physicist uses physics laws, accounts for the air friction and the wind, jumps and hits the pool
mathematician creates a model, calculates everything according to it, jumps and flies upwards to the skies because he missed a sign somewhere
Holy shit thats actually so true
popop, how make apple jump before shuriken on 99?i have 0/4

A QA engineer walks into a bar. Orders a beer. Orders 0 beers. Orders 99999999999 beers. Orders a lizard. Orders -1 beers. Orders a ueicbksjdhd. First real customer walks in and asks where the bathroom is. The bar bursts into flames, killing everyone.

TIL that dishwasher salmon is a thing
is sakura basically the hardest humanly possibly boss?
be the change you want to see
i have been summoned by the name of my work
what does "humanly possible" even mean anyways
the moment i wanted to watch
like, some TAS possible stuff is usually theoretically human possible unless it requires like, inhuman inputs (say alternating pressing and not every frame for an extended period of time)
also what the fuck is this attack
@Taprus_ youd probably have to identify required humanly impossible sequences of inputs
but like what makes inputs humanly impossible
@Vormanax_ i mean what else is there
is sakura harder than last tis because you put it as "the end" on the infinity stones list

also you can measure whether a boss is *statistically* possible or not, that being, how often does it give impossible situations - and if the expectation value of the time to get a possible attempt exceeds something like the human lifespan, then the boss is statisically impossbile
I'd say humanly impossible is something that if every human on the planet spent their life trying to beat, they'd all fail
find a jump that requires you to press 20 buttons at once
@Joshua_boring people will do it with some weird rebinds
@Vormanax_ How exactly would you quantify that, though
a word doesn't need to be deterministically measurable to be well defined
@Joshua_boring what if cactus strat in sustenance was required, 30 cactus releases on consecutive frames with only like five frames of lenience
if one person can't do it, but two people can, is it humanly impossible?
It's the good definition, but it's not exactly a useful term if defined like that
it's like saying "good" isn't a useful term
you can't call something impossible if it's been done
as indicated by you using it there
I'll be honest, I'm not even sure why I'm trying to disagree
it's good to disagree on purpose
fangame community don't have the same "humanly impossible" discussion for a week challenge
disagreeing is also just fun lol
Like, in the end, "humanly impossible" is a constantly updating and context dependant label
Deadsplit shows general improvement at pre mayumushi at least
the problem is that many times its used essentially interchangeably with "doable"
my position is that people are just wrong
on this discussion specifically or in life in general
because it can be applied to both
I mean I would go and call something humanly impossible if it'll take someone 30 years
it doesnt matter what the topic is
when I wrote that I meant that people calling things humanly impossible are usually just wrong
but I doubt someone wants to spend 30 years grinding one single thing
but people are just wrong in general too
people have done that many times though, romrom
not in games, but in other things
I agree with that, but I would refer to it as impossible interchangeably
If someone has worked for 30 years to make their artistic magnum opus, I wouldn't call that unreasonable
So im not sure if its necessarily unreasonable in the case of getting a clear
depends on a lot of course
Theyre dedicating a large portion of their life to one singular goal, im not sure its so different
there's a lot of context you changed with that example
I mean, im being incredibly reductionist that is true
I think research is a very fair comparison
lots of people have spent a LOT of time tackling yet to be solved math problems
look at wiles and fermat's last theorem
shoutouts to people spending their whole life on one problem and it not spanning out
I feel like it's different in that in math you don't always know what you have to do, whereas in fangame bosses you do, you just need to execute the inputs well
math and fangame bosses certainly aren't the same thing
I mean that's how multiple math fields spawned tap
but research is a general thing with humanity, and it's not just one person working on something for ages, and also there's a much bigger motive to solve problems like that
so if multiple people try to beat the same boss it makes it less unreasonable?
I don't know what I meant to say by general thing with humanity so just ignore that part lol
you don't get better by someone else playing
you can learn strats from them
noo i missed the hank attempt
I think if enough people beat the same boss it becomes easier to find strats
ok but you have to LEARN the strats
it still doesnt mean that you have the execution rewuired
this goes back to me asking about if multiple people do it rom
just like you have to learn other people's research
it's not the same as contributing a major part to a discovery
Yeah but you have an idea of what strats to learn
if 1000 people all beat 1 unique save of a game
if 7 separate people beat the 7 separate segments of solgryn
No but it is potentially unreasonable
is msr just incredibly difficult bosses?
yeah it's unreasonable but as I said before, I would use impossible for it interchangeably untill someone proves to have enough motivation to do it
something that would take a human 200 years to beat is (currently) humanly impossible
cause humans can't live that long
even if all parts of it can be beaten
japanese rap vacuum ukrainian screaming asmr
like do you remember when blue got like 3 phase 5 attempts in one session, that was a hell of a mindset change, I didn't think it would be done until then
yeah that's what I mean with people just being wrong
for all we know, there could always appear one exceptionally talented individual whose time to beat it would realistically be 50 years though, in which case it would be humanly possible
does humnaly impossible refer to impossible to be done by a single human then
I use the word that way nameless
the descent of god onto the mortal realm upon which he beats msr then leaves again
I already have someone like that in mind tap lol
@Taprus_ I'll still feel comfortable calling something impossible until that happens
how can you have someone in mind to beat a challenge we haven't even specified
like I get that I'm just wrong
yeah I'm a hero fuck you
I mean someone who just barges into fangames and becomes a god in months for no reason
As a community moves forward the view of viability changes as achievements happen, things don't lose their difficulty value but instead appear more mentally possible
my point is I don't care to be proven wrong, I'd love to be proven wrong even. but some things I just don't see being achieved and I will call them impossible until my mind is changed
some people are just built different
Anyways, I dont think there's anything wrong with calling things humanly impossible which are very much so and on the fringe
this is why msr has play tasers, to confirm there aren't impossible jumps
so when Mastermaxify2 drops they can beat it
like, its easy to get caught up in the hype, and I definitely have been before (melanzana), but it also makes it so much more exciting when a clear does come
bro defining a segment of the bosses would be crazy
yeah I can see the hype argument
I just care more about trying to be right lol
other times it just blends together
I mean you can't have a "humanly impossible" discussion without bringing up msr at some point lol
there are jumps that are stupid to just do once so if you want to do the platforming sometimes you have to treat a single jump as a l game save ig?
